page.title: 17ENTERTAINMENT: BARBERSHOP
page.content: There is a tradition growing in{Potton for{Barbershop}singing. The men formed their group in 1978 and six months later ladies began their own group. {Shannon Express}was the name chosen by the men and Seventh Heaven by the ladies but they soon changed it to {Phoenix}when they discovered another group called Seventh Heaven. Both groups are successful and have won awards at the yearly{Barbershop {Conventions.}The ladies won a small chorus trophy in 1983 and 1984. The men won a trophy in 1982. In 1984 they qualified to sing at York in October 1985. In February 1985 they sang on a BBC 1 programme called{Spectrum.}They have also sung on Chiltern Radio and Radio Milton Keynes. They have monthly singouts when they sing to the public to raise money and every year they have a{birthday show}for fun.
